description: '''Daijon Cotty Davis''' (born August 3, 1999), known professionally as '''DC The Don''', is an American rapper and singer from [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]]. He is recognized for mixing elements of [[Hip hop music|hip-hop]], [[Rock music|rock]], and [[melodic rap]] in his music. Prior to his rap career, Davis played high school basketball, alongside NBA star [[LaMelo Ball]], as they both participated in the sports program at [[Chino Hills High School]] in [[Chino Hills, California]]. Davis' musical journey and basketball past remain intertwined, both contributing to his position in the entertainment industry.
